column4: I've tried setting up a software RAID 5 under both Ubuntu and CentOS and they both fail at formatting.  I've tried using both ext3 and JFS.  Any ideas?
At which step does it fail?
I'm installing from scratch, and after I get it all partioned and it goes to format, it gets the root partition formatted, but fails when it tries to do the raid.
cent?
Cent or Ubuntu, both fail at the same step
ok...what does cat /proc/mdstat tell you?
Hmmm...can't tell you.  I aborted the install after the format failed.
hmm, ok...first how many drives?
And they are connected 2 each on 2 different above board IDE cards.
seperate system drive on the onboard controller.
is there an os on 1 of them?
No, they are all blank
ok, i just did exactly this at the begining of the week...
If you can get the os on one of the drives, it's just a matter of fdisk'ing the good partition onto the others
you use mdadm now instead of etc/raidtab
Ok, but is it difficult to "add" the raid into the system doing it that way?  I was hoping to just use the installer...
Course...I was only told that the drives are blank...they were used...I think maybe I'll try wiping them all...
oh definitely wipe them.
Okay, I'll do that.  Thanks!
the 3 other drives will need to be set to "fd" type in fdisk
Ok
